oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oath sworn by James Tinker
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Oath sworn by James Tinker to Washington County, Tenn. clerk stating that he is eligible to vote. More information about the circumstances related to this document is described in a book written by A. Christine Tipton, "Civil War in the Mountains." Tinker, who was born in 1805, never fought in the war, and died soon after he signed this oath when he was about 66 years old. He had sons who served in both sides of the conflict.
